title: Matthew Chapter 15 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Matthew chapter 15 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Matthew Chapter 15 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Matthew Chapter 15.

questions.question: Who came to Jesus to question Him about His disciples not washing their hands?
questions.correctAnswer: Scribes and Pharisees
questions.explanation: Matthew 15:1 states that scribes and Pharisees came to Jesus questioning His disciples.

questions.question: What tradition did the Pharisees accuse Jesus' disciples of transgressing?
questions.correctAnswer: Washing hands before eating
questions.explanation: In Matthew 15:2, the Pharisees questioned why Jesus' disciples did not wash their hands when they ate bread.

questions.question: According to Jesus in Matthew 15:4, what commandment did God give regarding parents?
questions.correctAnswer: Honour thy father and mother
questions.explanation: Matthew 15:4 quotes God's commandment to honour father and mother.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'This people draweth nigh unto me with their mouth, and honoureth me with their lips; but their ______ is far from me.'
questions.correctAnswer: heart
questions.explanation: In Matthew 15:8, Jesus quotes Esaias saying their heart is far from Him.

questions.question: What did Jesus say defiles a man?
options: What cometh out of the mouth
questions.correctAnswer: What cometh out of the mouth
questions.explanation: Matthew 15:11 explains that it is not what goes into the mouth but what comes out that defiles a person.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus told His disciples that eating with unwashed hands defiles a man.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Matthew 15:20 clarifies that eating with unwashed hands does not defile a man.

questions.question: Where did Jesus go after speaking about defilement and traditions?
questions.correctAnswer: Coasts of Tyre and Sidon
questions.explanation: Matthew 15:21 states Jesus departed to the coasts of Tyre and Sidon.

questions.question: Who came to Jesus asking for mercy because her daughter was vexed with a devil?
questions.correctAnswer: A woman of Canaan
questions.explanation: Matthew 15:22 identifies the woman as from Canaan seeking Jesus' help for her daughter.

questions.question: What was Jesus' initial response to the woman from Canaan?
options: He answered her not a word
questions.correctAnswer: He answered her not a word
questions.explanation: Matthew 15:23 records that Jesus did not answer her initially.

questions.question: What analogy did Jesus use when speaking to the woman of Canaan about children’s bread?
options: It is not meet to take the children's bread, and cast it to dogs
The fields are ripe for harvest
The good shepherd lays down his life
The mustard seed grows into a tree
questions.correctAnswer: It is not meet to take the children's bread, and cast it to dogs
questions.explanation: In Matthew 15:26, Jesus uses this analogy when replying to the woman.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus praised the woman's faith and healed her daughter immediately.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Matthew 15:28 shows Jesus commending her faith and her daughter was made whole.

questions.question: What kinds of people did great multitudes bring to Jesus to be healed near the sea of Galilee?
questions.correctAnswer: Lame, blind, dumb, maimed
questions.explanation: Matthew 15:30 describes the multitudes bringing those with various ailments.

questions.question: How long had the multitude stayed with Jesus without food, causing Him to have compassion?
questions.correctAnswer: Three days
questions.explanation: Matthew 15:32 states the people had been with Jesus for three days without food.

questions.question: True or False: The disciples were confident they had enough bread to feed the multitude in the wilderness.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: In Matthew 15:33, the disciples questioned where they could get enough bread for so many people.

questions.question: How many loaves and fishes did Jesus use to feed the four thousand men?
options: Seven loaves and a few little fishes
questions.correctAnswer: Seven loaves and a few little fishes
questions.explanation: Matthew 15:34 records that Jesus used seven loaves and a few fishes for the miracle.

medium.title: Matthew Chapter 15 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Matthew Chapter 15 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with obeying traditions that contradict God's commandments. Based on Matthew 15, what biblical principle would you share about obedience?
options: Obedience to God's commandments is more important than human traditions
Traditions should always be followed regardless of circumstances
Only Pharisees must obey God's commandments strictly
Traditions and commandments have equal weight
questions.correctAnswer: Obedience to God's commandments is more important than human traditions
questions.explanation: Jesus rebukes the Pharisees for transgressing God's commandments by their traditions (Matthew 15:3-6, 9). He emphasizes honoring God’s commands over human rules.

questions.question: How does Matthew 15 teach us about the importance of honoring parents in Christian living?
options: Honoring parents is a commandment from God that should not be nullified by traditions
Honoring parents is optional if it conflicts with traditions
Only children who are obedient receive blessings
Parents should serve their children first
questions.correctAnswer: Honoring parents is a commandment from God that should not be nullified by traditions
questions.explanation: Jesus cites the commandment to honor father and mother and criticizes those who nullify it by tradition (Matthew 15:4-6). This shows the biblical priority of honoring parents.

questions.question: A fellow believer is confused about what defiles a person. According to Matthew 15, what truly defiles a person?
options: What comes out of the mouth, reflecting the heart
questions.correctAnswer: What comes out of the mouth, reflecting the heart
questions.explanation: Jesus explains that defilement comes from within the heart and what proceeds out of the mouth, not from external things like unwashed hands (Matthew 15:11, 18-20).

questions.question: How does this passage teach us about humility and understanding in spiritual matters?
options: We should seek understanding and not remain blind to spiritual truths
It is acceptable to remain ignorant of spiritual teachings
Only religious leaders need to understand Scripture
questions.correctAnswer: We should seek understanding and not remain blind to spiritual truths
questions.explanation: Jesus questions His disciples’ lack of understanding and warns against being blind leaders (Matthew 15:14-16), encouraging humility and growth in spiritual insight.

questions.question: A believer faces criticism for showing faith in difficult situations. What does Matthew 15 reveal about faith through the story of the Canaanite woman?
options: Great faith can overcome barriers and receive God’s mercy
Faith is only for the Israelites
Faith must be proven by miracles
questions.correctAnswer: Great faith can overcome barriers and receive God’s mercy
questions.explanation: Jesus praises the woman’s great faith despite her background and grants her request, showing that faith opens the door to God’s mercy (Matthew 15:27-28).

questions.question: What does Matthew 15 teach about Jesus’ compassion and care for the needs of others?
options: Jesus cares deeply and provides for both spiritual and physical needs
Jesus only focuses on spiritual matters
Physical needs should be met by others, not Jesus
Compassion is shown only to the Israelites
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus cares deeply and provides for both spiritual and physical needs
questions.explanation: Jesus shows compassion for the hungry crowd and miraculously feeds them, demonstrating care for their physical and spiritual wellbeing (Matthew 15:32-38).

questions.question: How does Matthew 15 guide believers in dealing with criticism or offense from others about their faith?
options: Ignore those who lead others astray and remain focused on God’s truth
Change your beliefs to please critics
Avoid all confrontation to keep peace
Critics have more authority than God’s word
questions.correctAnswer: Ignore those who lead others astray and remain focused on God’s truth
questions.explanation: Jesus advises to let blind leaders alone because they will fall, encouraging believers to remain steadfast despite criticism (Matthew 15:13-14).

questions.question: True or False: According to Matthew 15, eating with unwashed hands defiles a person.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Jesus clearly states that eating with unwashed hands does not defile a person, but what comes out from the heart does (Matthew 15:20).

questions.question: True or False: Jesus only ministered to the people of Israel and ignored those from other regions.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Jesus initially focused on Israel (Matthew 15:24) but also ministered to the Canaanite woman and healed many in Gentile regions like Tyre and Sidon (Matthew 15:21-28).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus said, 'Not that which goeth into the mouth defileth a man; but that which cometh out of the _____, this defileth a man.'
questions.correctAnswer: mouth
questions.explanation: Jesus teaches that what comes out of the mouth defiles a person, indicating the importance of speech and heart condition (Matthew 15:11, 18).

questions.question: In the context of Matthew 15, how can a believer apply the teaching about the 'heart' in daily life?
options: Guard what comes from your heart because it affects your actions and words
Focus only on outward appearances and rituals
Ignore inner attitudes as long as you follow rules
Heart condition is irrelevant to spiritual life
questions.correctAnswer: Guard what comes from your heart because it affects your actions and words
questions.explanation: Jesus explains that evil thoughts and sins proceed from the heart and defile a person, highlighting the need for inner holiness (Matthew 15:18-20).

questions.question: What practical lesson about prayer and persistence can be learned from the Canaanite woman’s interaction with Jesus?
options: Persistent faith in prayer leads to God's mercy and answers
Prayer is ineffective unless you are part of Israel
One should stop praying if initially ignored
Prayer is only for physical needs
questions.correctAnswer: Persistent faith in prayer leads to God's mercy and answers
questions.explanation: The woman’s persistence in approaching Jesus despite initial silence shows the value of faith and perseverance in prayer (Matthew 15:22-28).

questions.question: How does Matthew 15 encourage believers to show generosity and stewardship with God's provisions?
options: Sharing and trusting God's provision leads to abundance
Only God’s servants should manage resources
Generosity is not important in faith
questions.correctAnswer: Sharing and trusting God's provision leads to abundance
questions.explanation: Jesus multiplies the loaves and fishes to feed thousands, illustrating God’s blessing on faithful sharing and trust (Matthew 15:36-38).

questions.question: How does the chapter teach about the importance of integrity and honesty in daily life?
options: True integrity comes from a pure heart reflected in words and actions
Integrity is only necessary in religious ceremonies
Honesty is optional if traditions require otherwise
questions.correctAnswer: True integrity comes from a pure heart reflected in words and actions
questions.explanation: Jesus links defilement to what proceeds from the heart, including false witness and blasphemy, emphasizing integrity (Matthew 15:18-20).

questions.question: What does Matthew 15 teach about how believers should respond to spiritual blindness in others?
options: Be cautious and avoid following blind leaders to prevent falling
Ignore spiritual blindness as it is not your concern
Blindness is permanent and cannot be corrected
questions.correctAnswer: Be cautious and avoid following blind leaders to prevent falling
questions.explanation: Jesus warns that blind leaders lead the blind into a ditch, teaching believers to be discerning in following spiritual guidance (Matthew 15:14).

hard.title: Matthew Chapter 15 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Matthew Chapter 15.

questions.question: In Matthew 15, Jesus accuses the Pharisees of transgressing which commandment by adhering to their tradition?
questions.correctAnswer: Honour thy father and mother
questions.explanation: Jesus highlights that the Pharisees' tradition nullifies the commandment to honour one's parents (Matthew 15:4-6).

questions.question: What does Jesus say defiles a man according to Matthew 15?
options: What cometh out of the mouth
questions.correctAnswer: What cometh out of the mouth
questions.explanation: Jesus teaches that defilement comes from what proceeds out of the mouth, reflecting the heart's condition (Matthew 15:11, 18).

questions.question: To whom did Jesus say He was sent, when speaking to the Canaanite woman?
options: The lost sheep of the house of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: The lost sheep of the house of Israel
questions.explanation: Jesus stated His mission was initially to the lost sheep of Israel, indicating the priority of His ministry (Matthew 15:24).

questions.question: What literary device is primarily used in Jesus' statement: 'If the blind lead the blind, both shall fall into the ditch'?
questions.correctAnswer: Metaphor
questions.explanation: Jesus uses metaphor to illustrate the folly of blind leaders leading blind followers (Matthew 15:14).

questions.question: How does Matthew 15 demonstrate a typological connection to the Old Testament with the quotation from Esaias (Isaiah)?
questions.correctAnswer: It shows hypocrisy in worship
questions.explanation: Jesus cites Isaiah's prophecy condemning hypocritical worship, linking His critique with Israel’s prophetic tradition (Matthew 15:7-9).

questions.question: What Greek word translated as 'hypocrites' in Matthew 15:7 originally meant in the cultural context?
questions.correctAnswer: Actors or stage players
questions.explanation: The term 'hypocrites' comes from the Greek for actors, implying those who pretend righteousness (Matthew 15:7).

questions.question: Which theme in Matthew 15 is foreshadowed by Jesus’ interaction with the Canaanite woman?
options: The extension of salvation to Gentiles
questions.correctAnswer: The extension of salvation to Gentiles
questions.explanation: Jesus’ response to the Canaanite woman anticipates the gospel’s reach beyond Israel (Matthew 15:21-28).

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus healing many at the Sea of Galilee in Matthew 15:29-31 in light of His ministry?
options: It demonstrates His messianic power and compassion
It fulfills a prophecy about Elijah
It shows His rejection of Jewish law
It marks the beginning of His teaching ministry
questions.correctAnswer: It demonstrates His messianic power and compassion
questions.explanation: The healings show Jesus’ authority and mercy, affirming His identity as Messiah (Matthew 15:30-31).

questions.question: In the feeding of the four thousand, what is the significance of the number seven loaves used by Jesus?
options: Represents the seven days of creation
questions.correctAnswer: Symbolizes completeness and God's provision
questions.explanation: Seven often symbolizes completeness in Scripture, emphasizing God's full provision in the miracle (Matthew 15:34-36).

questions.question: What historical and cultural context explains why the Pharisees were concerned about washing hands before eating?
options: Jewish purity laws and oral traditions emphasized ritual cleanliness
Roman customs required hand washing before meals
It was a common Gentile practice
questions.correctAnswer: Jewish purity laws and oral traditions emphasized ritual cleanliness
questions.explanation: Pharisaic tradition upheld hand washing as a ritual purity act, which Jesus critiques as tradition overriding God's command (Matthew 15:2-3).

questions.question: How does the theme of inner purity versus external ritual in Matthew 15 relate to the broader biblical narrative?
options: It echoes prophetic calls for heartfelt obedience over mere ritual
It contradicts the law of Moses
questions.correctAnswer: It echoes prophetic calls for heartfelt obedience over mere ritual
questions.explanation: The emphasis on heart purity recalls prophets like Isaiah who denounced empty ritual (Matthew 15:8-9).

questions.question: Which Old Testament commandment is quoted and discussed in Matthew 15 to highlight the conflict between God's law and human tradition?
options: Thou shalt not bear false witness
questions.correctAnswer: Honour thy father and mother
questions.explanation: Jesus quotes this commandment to show how traditions nullify God's law (Matthew 15:4-6).

questions.question: True or False: Jesus in Matthew 15 teaches that eating with unwashed hands defiles a person.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Jesus explicitly says that eating with unwashed hands does not defile a person (Matthew 15:20).

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'great is thy faith' spoken by Jesus to the Canaanite woman in Matthew 15?
options: It acknowledges the woman's faith despite her Gentile status
It indicates she was a disciple
It shows Jesus’ approval of all traditions
questions.correctAnswer: It acknowledges the woman's faith despite her Gentile status
questions.explanation: Jesus praises her faith, highlighting that faith transcends ethnic boundaries (Matthew 15:28).

questions.question: How does Matthew 15:13-14 reflect the concept of divine judgment in the chapter?
options: Unplanted plants (false teachings) will be rooted up
All will be forgiven without repentance
Tradition is more important than law
questions.correctAnswer: Unplanted plants (false teachings) will be rooted up
questions.explanation: Jesus warns that teachings not from God will be destroyed, indicating divine judgment (Matthew 15:13-14).

theological.title: Matthew Chapter 15 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Matthew Chapter 15 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Matthew 15, why did the scribes and Pharisees confront Jesus about His disciples?
options: Because they did not wash their hands when they ate bread
Because they preached on the Sabbath
Because they healed on the Sabbath
Because they did not fast regularly
questions.correctAnswer: Because they did not wash their hands when they ate bread
questions.explanation: Matthew 15:2 states the Pharisees questioned Jesus about His disciples not washing their hands before eating, which was a tradition of the elders, highlighting the tension between human tradition and divine command. This issue reflects God's command for true purity beyond ritual (Isaiah 29:13, Mark 7:6-8, Colossians 2:20-23, Hebrews 9:9).

questions.question: What commandment of God did Jesus say the Pharisees were transgressing by their tradition?
options: Remember the Sabbath day, to keep it holy
questions.correctAnswer: Honour thy father and mother
questions.explanation: Jesus said in Matthew 15:4 that God commanded to honor father and mother, but Pharisaic tradition nullified this by allowing people to declare gifts that exempted them from supporting their parents. This shows how human tradition can contradict God's law (Exodus 20:12, Deuteronomy 5:16, Ephesians 6:2-3, Mark 7:9-13).

questions.question: How did Jesus describe those who follow traditions that nullify God's commandments?
questions.correctAnswer: Hypocrites
questions.explanation: In Matthew 15:7, Jesus calls the Pharisees 'hypocrites' for honoring God with their lips while their hearts are far from Him, quoting Isaiah 29:13. This reveals the disconnect between external religiosity and true heart obedience (Isaiah 29:13, Matthew 23:27-28, James 1:26-27, Romans 12:9).

questions.question: According to Jesus in Matthew 15, what defiles a man?
options: What cometh out of the mouth
questions.correctAnswer: What cometh out of the mouth
questions.explanation: Jesus teaches in Matthew 15:11 that it is not what enters the mouth that defiles a person, but what proceeds out of the mouth, reflecting the heart's corruption. This highlights the biblical truth that sin originates in the heart (Proverbs 4:23, Jeremiah 17:9, Mark 7:20-23, James 3:6).

questions.question: What are some of the evil things that proceed from the heart, defiling a man, as listed in Matthew 15?
options: Evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false witness, blasphemies
Pride, greed, envy, jealousy, wrath, slander, gossip
Idolatry, witchcraft, sorcery, lying, deceit, rebellion
Covetousness, anger, impatience, laziness, bitterness, hypocrisy
questions.correctAnswer: Evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false witness, blasphemies
questions.explanation: Matthew 15:19 explicitly lists these sins as originating from the heart, which defile a person. This teaching aligns with the biblical doctrine of original sin and human depravity (Genesis 6:5, Mark 7:21-23, Romans 3:10-18, Galatians 5:19-21).

questions.question: What was Jesus' response when the Canaanite woman asked Him for mercy for her demon-possessed daughter?
options: He said He was sent only to the lost sheep of Israel
He told her to go away
questions.correctAnswer: He said He was sent only to the lost sheep of Israel
questions.explanation: In Matthew 15:24, Jesus states His primary mission was to the lost sheep of Israel, reflecting the Messianic focus on Israel before the gospel is extended to the Gentiles (Romans 1:16, John 1:11, Matthew 10:5-6, Acts 13:46).

questions.question: How did the Canaanite woman demonstrate her faith despite Jesus' initial refusal?
options: She said, 'Truth, Lord: yet the dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from their masters' table'
She asked the disciples for help
questions.correctAnswer: She said, 'Truth, Lord: yet the dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from their masters' table'
questions.explanation: Matthew 15:27 shows the woman's humble yet confident faith, acknowledging Jesus' words but asserting that even a small blessing from Him is sufficient. This exemplifies persistent faith (Luke 18:1-8, Hebrews 11:6, James 1:6-7, Mark 7:28).

questions.question: What was Jesus' commendation of the Canaanite woman after she expressed her faith?
options: Your faith has made you whole
questions.correctAnswer: Great is thy faith
questions.explanation: Jesus praises her faith explicitly in Matthew 15:28, showing that faith is key for receiving God's blessing. This resonates with many biblical affirmations of faith's power to heal and save (Matthew 9:22, Hebrews 11:1, Romans 4:20-21, James 2:18).

questions.question: What was the response of the multitude when Jesus healed the lame, blind, dumb, and maimed?
options: They glorified the God of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: They glorified the God of Israel
questions.explanation: Matthew 15:31 records that the crowd glorified God after witnessing miracles, affirming the divine power at work in Jesus. This reflects biblical themes of God's glory revealed through His Messiah (Psalm 105:1-3, Isaiah 35:5-6, John 9:3, Acts 3:13-16).

questions.question: Why did Jesus express compassion for the multitude in the wilderness according to Matthew 15?
options: Because they had been with Him for three days and had nothing to eat
Because they were sick and needed healing
Because they refused to leave Him
Because they were lost and needed guidance
questions.correctAnswer: Because they had been with Him for three days and had nothing to eat
questions.explanation: In Matthew 15:32, Jesus shows compassion due to their physical condition after three days, emphasizing His care for both spiritual and physical needs, consistent with God's provision for His people (Exodus 16:3-4, John 6:5-14, Psalm 23:1, Isaiah 58:10).

questions.question: How many loaves and fishes did Jesus use to feed the four thousand men, besides women and children?
options: Seven loaves and a few little fishes
questions.correctAnswer: Seven loaves and a few little fishes
questions.explanation: Matthew 15:34-36 describes Jesus using seven loaves and a few little fishes to miraculously feed the multitude, demonstrating His divine provision. This miracle prefigures the Eucharist and God's sustaining grace (John 6:9-14, Exodus 16:15, Psalm 78:24-25, Mark 8:1-9).

questions.question: What happened to the leftover food after everyone ate in the feeding of the four thousand?
options: They took up seven baskets full
They gave it to the poor
questions.correctAnswer: They took up seven baskets full
questions.explanation: According to Matthew 15:37, seven baskets of leftovers were gathered, illustrating the abundance of Jesus' provision and God's overflowing grace (John 6:12, Exodus 16:18, Luke 9:17, 2 Corinthians 9:8).

questions.question: What warning did Jesus give about the Pharisees and their teaching in Matthew 15?
options: They are blind leaders of the blind and both shall fall into the ditch
They are the light of the world
They are the salt of the earth
They will inherit the kingdom of God
questions.correctAnswer: They are blind leaders of the blind and both shall fall into the ditch
questions.explanation: In Matthew 15:14, Jesus warns that Pharisees who reject God's word and lead others astray are blind leaders, resulting in destruction. This aligns with biblical warnings against false teachers (Isaiah 42:19, 2 Peter 2:1-3, Jeremiah 5:21, Romans 16:17-18).

questions.question: How did Jesus explain the parable to His disciples about what defiles a person in Matthew 15?
options: That what enters the mouth passes through the body, but what comes out of the mouth originates from the heart
That food laws must be strictly observed
That washing hands is necessary for purity
That external rituals cleanse the soul
questions.correctAnswer: That what enters the mouth passes through the body, but what comes out of the mouth originates from the heart
questions.explanation: Jesus explained in Matthew 15:17-18 that dietary intake does not defile a person, but the words and actions that come from the heart do. This teaching underscores the heart's role in moral purity (Proverbs 4:23, Jeremiah 17:9, Mark 7:15, Luke 6:45).

questions.question: What does Matthew 15 reveal about Jesus' mission focus before extending His ministry beyond Israel?
options: He was sent only to the lost sheep of Israel
He came to save all nations immediately
He avoided the people of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: He was sent only to the lost sheep of Israel
questions.explanation: In Matthew 15:24, Jesus clearly states His mission was primarily to Israel first, fulfilling Old Testament promises before the gospel expands to the Gentiles (Romans 15:8-12, John 1:11, Luke 4:18-19, Acts 13:46).
